Content.Text:
<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Right! I'll go get everything prepped, so just hold
on a couple minutes, 'kay? ♪

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well then, I will set myself to preparing our
meal. Please, have a seat.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Okay, I'll go cook us something tasty. Hang on a
few minutes while I work my magic.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well then, I will prepare us something to eat.
Have a seat and wait; it won't be long.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Right, I'll make something, then. Hang on a
minute.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Okay, I'll see what I can whip up. Just give me a
couple minutes.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Excellent. I will see to preparing our meal. Just
you wait, it'll be delicious.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
All right. I should have something ready for us in
a couple minutes.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Okay! I'll go cook something up for us, so fire up
your taste buds!

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'll go whip up some grub for us, then. Have a
seat and it'll be ready in no time.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well, I shall prepare something for us. It should
be ready in a matter of minutes.

<FACE_LICORICE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'll hit the kitchen, then. Take a seat, I'll be done
in a couple minutes.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
There, done! C'mon, let's dig in before it gets
cold. It's chow time! ♪

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
There, that should be everything. No need to
stand on ceremony. Let's eat.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Bam! One awesome meal, right to our table.
Let's dig in.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
There, that should do it. Shall we eat?

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Arright, done. Let's dig in.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
There, that should be everything. Get it while it's
hot.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
There. I have realized the apex of the domestic
culinary arts! Let's enjoy it.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Mmmm, this smells delicious, don't you think?
Let's eat.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
A hundred percent tasty, zero percent on fire!
Let's dig in.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
There, all done! ♪ C'mon, let's dig in. I'm
hungry as a horse!

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
There we go, a balanced meal. Let's eat.

<FACE_LICORICE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I did my own unique take on the recipe this
time. No, no, sit down, I was just kidding. Let's
eat.

<FACE_CHILD_B><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Yaaay! Time to eat!
<PAGE>
<FACE_CHILD_G><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>Let's eat! ♪

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Mmm, eating with you makes the food taste ten
times better than all those lonely nights of cup
noodles, <MYNAME>. I'm in for seconds! ♪

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
It's funny, you know? Time seems to fly by so
quickly when I'm enjoying a meal with you,
<MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
Though I suppose I could say the same of all the
time I spend with you. I try to savor each
moment.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'm pretty used to eating my own cooking by
now...
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>But for some reason, sitting here eating with you
makes it taste better. I made it the same as
always, but it just does. Weird, huh?

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I know it sounds hackneyed, but there's
something about sitting down to a meal with
your beloved that makes it taste even better.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
You really look like you're enjoying the food.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>Every time we eat together, I end up looking at
you and forget to keep taking bites.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Y'know, they're right that eating together with
someone makes food taste better. When I'm with
you, I'm always hungry for what's next.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOVE>
It's strange. When I sit to enjoy a meal with you,
the food tastes decidedly better. I wonder why
that is...

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
It always seems like the time goes by quicker
when we eat together. I always look forward to
next time before the meal is even done.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Y'know, food tastes so much better when I get
to eat with you, <MYNAME>. I wonder why.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>Could it be just because I'm getting to spend
time with the one I love? Ooooh, spicy!

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I really love sitting down and eating together
with you like this, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
Watching you enjoy every bite makes me feel so
warm and content! <RED>∀</RED>

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
It's so easy for me to lose track of the time when
I sit here to eat with you.
<PAGE>
I guess that means I find spending this time
together so entertaining that the time flies.

<FACE_LICORICE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOVE>
Mmm. Eating with you definitely makes the food
taste better. It's completely different from all
those meals I used to eat alone.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Tsk tsk, no being picky, <MYNAME>. You've
gotta eat everything on your plate!
<PAGE>
You'll totally regret not eating it later, when
you're so hungry you can hardly move! By then,
it'll be too late!

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I can understand not finishing your meal
because you're full, but leaving perfectly good
food just because you dislike the taste?
<PAGE>
Of course, you would never do that... Right,
<MYNAME>?

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
If there's anything you don't like, don't be afraid
to say so. I can always cook it up in a way you'll
love.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I AM a chef, y'know. I stake my livelihood on
making all kinds of things delicious.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Though we're husband and wife now, I promise
I'll never chastise you for being a fussy eater or
not cleaning your plate.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>So...I would appreciate it if you'd let me off the
hook about how fussy an eater I can be, okay?

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, try not to leave food on your plate
just because you don't like it. I'll do the same, of
course.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Even if you're not feelin' the dish of the day,
<MYNAME>, try your best to eat what's on your
plate.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I'll try to clean my plate when you cook, too --
not that that'd be a challenge.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Don't you dare leave any of the food I lovingly
prepared just because you "don't like the taste."
Understood?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>If I see any food pushed aside on your plate, I
may just have to reprimand you.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
If you really don't like something, I won't force
you to eat it.
<PAGE>
But I hope you keep in mind that I put a lot of
love and effort into cooking this meal for you.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Ahaha...! You're such a sweetheart. Maybe it
was unfair of me to guilt-trip you like that.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Wait, you can't throw the stuff you don't like out
the window, okay <MYNAME>? Good boys and
girls always clean their plates.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Whoops, heehee! I've said that so many times on
this children's show I'm in that it just kind of
tumbled out.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Hey now, no skipping food just 'cause you think
it's yucky! I worked really hard to cook this for
you, so let's really savor it. <RED>∀</RED>

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Proper nutrition is the foundation of good
health, so you mustn't be picky about your food.
It's important to have a balanced diet.

<FACE_LICORICE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
C'mon, you've gotta eat it all up. Otherwise, I will
have made the kitchen a disaster area for
nothing.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hey <MYNAME>, when it's my turn to cook, let
me know if there's anything you'd like to eat.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>It makes cooking a lot more fun when you know
someone's lookin' forward to it! ♪

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I know we're taking turns and such, but if you
ever feel too busy, just let me know. I'd gladly
take an extra turn for you.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>We both may have full schedules, but when it
comes down to it, mine allows me a greater
degree of flexibility.
<PAGE>
When you need support, let me know. That's
part of what being married is about, after all.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I know that since I'm a chef, it means more
often than not I'm the one doing the cooking...
<PAGE>
But when it's your turn to cook, <MYNAME>, I
get excited thinking about the flavor journey
you're about to send me on!
<PAGE>
I don't want you to just cede the kitchen to me
because cooking's my job. If you want in, just
say so. I love trying your cooking.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You know, I find the idea that domestic chores
should be the sole province of the wife to be an
antiquated notion.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Especially in our case, as we're both busy with
work. I think sharing the chores equally, as we
have been, is the most equitable practice.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
If you don't like what I make, say so.
<PAGE>
When we decided to get married, I did try to
improve my cooking, but I know I'm still not that
great.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>What's with that surprised look? I DO think about
those kinds of things, y'know.
<PAGE>
I mean, if somebody with more zeal than skill
told me they'd cook, but then made something
gross, I don't think I could take it.
<PAGE>
So anyway...if you don't like it, tell me. I won't
take it hard, because you'll be letting me know
where I need to shore up.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Feel free to make requests, okay? Whatever you
ask for, I'll serve it up hot.
<PAGE>
Well...as long as it's not too complicated,
anyway. If there's a big list of ingredients and
cooking times, I can't make any promises.
<PAGE>
I'll still make a valiant effort when it's my turn,
though. If you have any requests, don't hold
them back now, all right?

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
At first, I was positively shocked at being
expected to prepare meals myself, but cooking
for someone I love is surprisingly rewarding.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Just to give you fair warning, I may have to ask
you to handle the cooking more often as I get
closer to my deadlines.
<PAGE>
But by the same token, whenever you're up to
your ears in work, feel free to ask me to take
charge of the kitchen.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
When it's your turn to cook, do you ever have
trouble deciding what to make?
<PAGE>
I'm always second-guessing myself, thinking,
"Would he like THIS best? Oh wait, he always
wolfs down THAT dish..."
<PAGE>
I hope you like what I chose for today.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I have so much fun thinking about what I want
to make when it's my turn to cook.
<PAGE>
And when it's your turn, I like the suspense of
seeing what you're going to make...
<PAGE>
so no matter who's in the kitchen, I find that I'm
always looking forward to mealtime! ♪

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
If you have any particular preferences when it's
my turn to cook, don't hesitate to make a
request.
<PAGE>
It's easier to decide what to cook when I know
what you're in the mood for. That also makes
the meal preparation feel more worthwhile.

<FACE_LICORICE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I know there are times when I get so caught up
in my research that I forget to even eat, to say
nothing of cooking.
<PAGE>
When I'm in the zone, don't be afraid to come
shake me out of it, okay?
<PAGE>
If you don't, you're likely to wind up on
permanent kitchen duty, and that'd proooobably
defeat the point of us taking turns.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Heh heh! I'm pretty handy in the kitchen, aren't
I? I've always said real men should be masters of
chores both indoors and outdoors!
<PAGE>
Aren'tcha glad you married me? You could've
picked anyone, but you shot that arrow right at
my heart, so I'll never make you regret it! ♪

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I like to think I'm a fair hand at cooking, but if
you ever have any, er...concerns about the food,
please let me know.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I know I'm a pretty good cook, but everybody's
tastes are different. If you think a dish needs a
little something extra, let me know.
<PAGE>
That said, I've been keeping tabs on your
favorites ever since we started dating, so I think
I've got that covered.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I like to think I'm a fair cook, but I'll be the first
to admit my repertoire is...a bit narrow.
<PAGE>
I have the tendency to only make the things I
personally like, after all.
<PAGE>
But since we'll be eating together now, I'm going
to learn some new recipes so I don't bore you
time and time again with the same foods.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
I'm not bad at making big, easy one-pot meals,
but when there's a lot of little, fiddly dishes, I'm
in trouble.
<PAGE>
That I'm even as good as I am now is 'cause I
got to marry you, so if the quality's got a way to
go, don't be too harsh, okay?

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I've always been fine with being an average
cook, so I feel a little embarrassed being called
on to cook for someone else.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Once we got engaged, I started trying to improve
as a cook, but...results have been mixed, let's
say.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>You might have to give me some lessons on
how you do it sometime, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
I don't want my wife to have to eat my half-
baked cooking forever, you know. I'm all about
satisfaction.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
What do you think of my cooking? Have I
achieved proficiency as a chef, or do you find
my skills...lacking?
<PAGE>
To be honest, I had hardly cooked at all before
we were wed. But now that we've been living
together, I like to think I'm rather good.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Do you enjoy the things I've been making? I sure
hope so.
<PAGE>
I like to think I was a pretty good chef even
before we were together, but you've given me
lots more opportunities to practice.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Y'know, I've always thought of myself as a pretty
good cook, even when I have one of those little
"whoopsie!" moments.
<PAGE>
What do you think, <MYNAME>? Isn't it deeee-
licious?

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Lillie's been teaching me more about cooking!
She's always so enthusiastic and optimistic,
even when something has a weird smell. 
<PAGE>
I wanna learn how to cook the yummiest food
for you, <MYNAME>!

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I've had many years of practice cooking, so I like
to think I've achieved a considerable level of
proficiency.
<PAGE>
I'm glad for all those years, though, because
now I can have confidence that I'm preparing
delicious meals for you.

<FACE_LICORICE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
They used to tell me, "If you want to be hailed as
a domestic goddess, marry a man who's worse
at cooking than you." But did I listen? Noooo...
<PAGE>
Well, you don't really complain about my
cooking, so that's not the problem...
<PAGE>
It's more that I want to make food so good,
you'll wolf it down, so I'm setting a high bar for
myself.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
When I was growin' up, my family always ate
meals together. That's just the way things were.
<PAGE>
So when I first moved here, it was hard getting
used to the idea of eating meals by myself. It
was so quiet.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I left home at a young age, so for much of my
life I've taken my meals alone.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I'm surprised at how much I now enjoy
gathering around the table and eating together as
a family. I wouldn't miss it for the world.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Growing up, everybody was busy running the
restaurant, so we never really sat down to eat
together like normal families do.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Having a time where we can all sit down and
enjoy some good food and conversation has
always been a dream of mine.
<PAGE>
So, you've literally made a dream of mine come
true, <MYNAME>. Thanks.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I had always eaten with my sister, but now that I
dine with you, it's quite remarkable how different
mealtimes feel.
<PAGE>
Dining with my sister was pleasant; a quiet and
relaxing affair...
<PAGE>
...but sharing a meal with you is bright and
cheerful and full of laughter. It's as though I'm
discovering new colors for the first time.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I traveled around by myself for such a long time,
I don't even remember the last time I
consistently sat down to eat with someone.
<PAGE>
To be honest it, uh, feels a little weird to me.
Not that that's a bad thing.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
The last place I lived, I stayed at a cafe. That
place was busy almost 'round the clock.
<PAGE>
Once I decided to open a shop of my own, I was
pretty busy, too. I didn't have much time to sit
down with someone to eat.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I actually like getting together at the table as a
family like we do. It makes me feel warm inside.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
My parents have always been very busy people.
They were hardly ever home for mealtimes, so
much of the time I ate by myself.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>So I find being able to sit down to the table
together with the whole family to be an
unexpectedly wonderful experience!
<PAGE>
I hope we'll always take this time to be together,
It's become very dear to me.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Ohoho...you always make mealtimes so lively
and lighthearted.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>For so long it had just been Mistel and me, and
he's such a reserved and contemplative boy for
his age.
<PAGE>
Our meals were generally peaceful and relaxing,
but never like now, full of such energy and
cheer.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Both atmospheres have their charms, of course,
but these lively mealtimes seem so fresh to me
that I find them especially delightful.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Since my family runs an inn, we often have our
guests join us for meals, so I've always thought
of dinner as a lively time full of gabbing.
<PAGE>
But I love that we get to eat together just as a
family now. It's the perfect balance of lively and
relaxing.

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I used to put taking care of the animals ahead of
taking care of myself, so I got into the habit of
eating quick meals so I could get back to work.
<PAGE>
But now that we're eating together as a family,
I've found I'm really slowing down and savoring
the food -- and our time together.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>After all, it's time I get to spend with my family.
It's way too precious to just rush through.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Even when I was a little girl, my mother was
very busy. I recall eating dinner alone many
times when work would keep her late.
<PAGE>
I don't think that is a bad thing, per se, but in
truth, it did make me feel a bit lonely.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>So I was determined that when I had a family
and children, we would try to have meals
together as often as possible.
<PAGE>
You feel the same way, don't you <MYNAME>? I
hope so.

<FACE_LICORICE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I've never really made a habit of eating with other
people. When I'm sitting across from someone,
it's like...what do I do?
<PAGE>
I'll know I'll get used to it eventually, but if I look
at you weird once in a while, just take it in
stride.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Come to think of it, I was a pretty picky eater as
a kid.
<PAGE>
My parents always bring up how I'd never even
touch milk or vegetables. I love 'em now,
though. I wonder why I didn't like 'em back then.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Still, I never could've guessed I'd wind up a
farmer. The future's nothing if not surprising!

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You aren't a terribly fussy eater, are you,
<MYNAME>?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>When I was young, I ate anything put in front of
me. However, as I've grown older, I've developed
some...preferences, you could say.
<PAGE>
Instead of becoming less picky, it feels like my
tastes have narrowed with age.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Y'know, it's not that I'm not a born gourmand or
anything like that.
<PAGE>
I grew up in a restaurant. I was always learning
things from my grandpa. Before I knew it, I'd
gained an appreciation for all kinds of food.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Hm? You want to know if it's true I hate
peppers? Who did you hear that from?
<PAGE>
<FACE_ANGRY>I not only used to hate them, I still detest them
to this day! Is there anything wrong with that?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Oh, you were just checking to see if you should
avoid using peppers in your cooking? Well, in
that case, I'm glad you checked.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Eh? Is there something I only started liking to eat
once I grew up?
<PAGE>
Well...if drinks count, I HAVE developed a taste
for coffee recently.
<PAGE>
When I was a kid, I didn't really know what good
food was, but I'm getting a better idea.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
As a kid, I had a real sweet tooth that's
mellowed out as I've gotten older. These days, I
don't have much of a craving for sweets.
<PAGE>
In fact, even the smell of sweets can be too
much, at times.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>? Are there any foods you've grown
to like or hate more than you did in childhood?
<PAGE>
I've heard that a person's taste buds will often
change as they grow into adulthood.
<PAGE>
My preferences have not changed much, but I
sometimes wonder if others' have.

<FACE_IRIS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Have you ever noticed that the number of foods
you like grows as you mature?
<PAGE>
I have. Strangely, you often hear people say they
like more foods than when they were children,
but rarely the other way around.

<FACE_LILIE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
They say that as you grow up, you learn to like a
lot of food that you never touched as a child...
<PAGE>
But the truth is, I still can't stand a lot of the
stuff I hated when I was little.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>I'm already an adult, but maybe it's not too late
for my tastes to change.
<PAGE>
You think that someday, I'll learn to eat the foods
I've hated my whole life?

<FACE_MENOU><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
I've never liked black teas, even when I was little.
<PAGE>
I hear that people learn to like more things as
they grow up, but I still don't think I'll ever
develop a taste for tea.
<PAGE>
It's hard to explain, but doesn't it...I dunno...feel
weird when you swallow a sip? I don't mean
taste, it's more an um...feel, I guess.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Have you ever heard that people's tastes are
prone to change as they grow older?
<PAGE>
It's said that this is caused by a weakening of
the tongue's functionality as we age.
<PAGE>
So as you grow up, your taste buds become
dulled, which makes a wider variety of foods
palatable as an adult.
<PAGE>
At least, that's what they say. I don't know if
that's the only reason tastes change, or even if
it's a legitimate reason at all.

<FACE_LICORICE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You always hear about how kids hate vegetables,
but for whatever reason, I was the opposite. I've
always loved veggies.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I guess even when I was little, I had a deep
affinity for plants, huh?

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
WAAA--CHOO!!
<PAGE>
Oof. Sorry, that was quite a sneeze. Guess
somebody's talkin' about me behind my back.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
...CHOO!
<PAGE>
Apologies. I couldn't stifle that one in time.
Perhaps someone is spreading rumors about
me. I hope they're good ones.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
AH-CHOO!!
<PAGE>
Sorry. Didn't mean to sneeze. Maybe I'm
catching cold. Or maybe I should lay off the
pepper in the kitchen.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
...CHOO!
<PAGE>
Pardon me. Perhaps I'm coming down with
